definition: to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: His voice was perfectly calm and confident.
sentences.chinese: 屠维岳鞠躬，非常镇定非常自信地回答。
他吸了一口气，强自镇定。

sentences.english: Hui hai behaved calm after listen to, but also to his nephew and general manager of MingWei lectured.
sentences.chinese: 汇海听后表现镇定，还向其侄儿兼总经理明威训话。

sentences.english: To calm his mind he began to take laudanum.
sentences.chinese: 为了镇定自己的神经，他开始服鸦片酊。

sentences.english: There was a self-possessed young lady connected with these accessories;
sentences.chinese: 穿戴这些衣饰的是一个沉着镇定的年轻女子。

sentences.english: He tried to look AS sober AS he could, but the police could immdiately tell he wAS lying!
sentences.chinese: 他尽量装的镇定，但是警察一眼就发现他在撒谎。

sentences.english: Remained calm when Reina saved his spot-kick.
sentences.chinese: 在雷纳扑出点球时保持了镇定。

sentences.english: Please prescribe some tranquilizers for me.

sentences.chinese: 瑜伽，她说，“是我的镇定剂。”

sentences.english: Once the words sound fall, there is one silk penitence , how performance so not town settle.
sentences.chinese: 话音一落，就有一丝后悔，怎么表现得这么不镇定。

sentences.english: He faced the attack with amazing sangfroid .
The problem of feedback stabilization for a class of neutral systems with computible delay is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究一类时滞可公度的中立型系统的反馈镇定。

sentences.english: She always stays cool, calm and collected in a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 她在危急关头总是很冷静镇定，处之泰然。

sentences.english: His calm reception of the bad news surprised his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他听到坏消息镇定自若，令他的朋友们惊奇。

sentences.english: Though in great trouble, he kept calm and never gave up.
sentences.chinese: 尽管困难重重，但他却镇定自若，决不放弃。

sentences.english: Are you good at staying 2)calm in life-or-death 3)situations?
sentences.chinese: 在生死攸关时，你是否擅长于保持镇定？

definition: cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
